content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="fgdc_classic.xsl"?> <metadata xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://water.usgs.gov/GIS/metadata/usgswrd/fgdc-std-001-1998.xsd">  <idinfo>   <citation>    <citeinfo>     <origin>Donald R Pool</origin>     <origin>Stanley Leake</origin>     <origin>Jesse Dickinson</origin>     <pubdate>2014</pubdate>     <title>Digitial data points of water-level observations for the Mesozoic aquifers in the Upper Colorado River Basin</title>     <geoform>Vector Digital Data Set (Point)</geoform>     <pubinfo>      <pubplace>Reston, Virginia</pubplace>      <publish>U.S. Geological Survey</publish>     </pubinfo>     <onlink>http://water.usgs.gov/lookup/getspatial?ucrb_Mesozoic_obs</onlink>    </citeinfo>   </citation>   <descript>    <abstract>These digital point data of the altitude of the Mesozoic rocks of the Upper Colorado River Basin were created for the purpose of developing a generalized predevelopment groundwater flow model of the Mesozoic and Paleozoic aquifers in the Upper Colorado River Basin (UCRB) and use that model along with a few recharge estimates to estimate water budgets for the aquifers including associated groundwater contributions to the Colorado River surface water system. The modeling exercise also explored considerations for development of a more detailed groundwater flow model that would include all of the major aquifers in the Upper Colorado River Basin.</abstract>    <purpose>These data were derived from various other sources (maps) in order to provide observed hydrologic control for the calibration of  the Upper Colorado River Basin Groundwater Flow Model, when used with additional information of estimated groundwater discharge to streams and estimated hydraulic properties of the aquifers.</purpose>    <supplinf>Observations for calibration of the groundwater model hydraulic properties to heads in the simulated Mesozoic and Paleozoic aquifers were derived from scanned and rectified map figures in several reports and a few observations at wells.  The published figures primarily included water-level contours with no plotted control water levels. Points were digitized from the contour lines at numerous locations deemed expressive of the contour shape. Two reports included individual observations. Data are as current as the publications that provided the information and maps. See Source Input section for citations of data used for development of this dataset.</supplinf>   </descript>   <timeperd>    <timeinfo>     <sngdate>      <caldate>2013</caldate>     </sngdate>    </timeinfo>    <current>See Supplemental Info</current>   </timeperd>   <status>    <progress>Complete</progress>    <update>None planned</update>   </status>   <spdom>    <bounding>     <westbc>-112.126792452</westbc>     <eastbc>-106.511133543</eastbc>     <northbc>42.280901811</northbc>     <southbc>35.065346166</southbc>    </bounding>   </spdom>   <keywords>    <theme>     <themekt>None</themekt>     <themekey>inlandWaters</themekey>     <themekey>groundwater</themekey>     <themekey>potentiometric head</themekey>     <themekey>control points</themekey>    </theme>    <place>     <placekt>None</placekt>     <placekey>Colorado</placekey>     <placekey>Arizona</placekey>     <placekey>Utah</placekey>     <placekey>New Mexico</placekey>    </place>   </keywords>   <accconst>None. Water-level observations for the San Juan Basin area.</srccontr>    </srcinfo>    <procstep>     <procdesc>     1. Saved pdf version of figures as tif files. Development of the original data are by the originators of those reports.     2. Within a GIS, georeferenced the maps, and digitized observation points, and points of interest along contours deemed indicative of the contour curve, and saved as shapefiles.     3. Reprojected shapefiles to this project's projection.     4. Assigned altitude values to each point.      5. Appended point shapefiles.</procdesc>     <procdate>2013</procdate>    </procstep>    <procstep>     <procdesc>Created comma-delimited text file of point data from dataset attribute table. Projection is project projection (UTM Zone 12, NAD83).</procdesc>     <procdate>2014</procdate>    </procstep>   </lineage>  </dataqual>  <spdoinfo>   <direct>Point</direct>   <ptvctinf>    <sdtsterm> simulated Mesozoic and Paleozoic aquifers were derived from scanned and rectified map figures in several reports and a few observations at wells.  The published figures primarily included water-level contours with no plotted control water levels.  Two reports included individual observations. Please review the more detailed descriptions that are provided (the individual attribute descriptions) for information on the values that appear as fields/table entries of the data set.</eaover>    <eadetcit>Original report figures: HA-668 (Plate 2, Fig. 15, Ground-water movement and occurrence in Glen Canyon Group and equivalent formations; polyline coverage of potentiometric surface contours WRIR 88-4086 (Fig. 18, Simulated steady-state potentiometric surface of the Entrada-Navajo aquifer, 1950-1983; point coverage of control water-levels at wells; points included in final dataset). Measured altitude of potentiometric surface, in feet (control points) and altitude of the potentiometric surface, contour interval 200 feet (contours) WRIR 95-4187 (Fig. 51, Computed steady-state head in the Dakota Sandstone; points digitized from potentiometric surface contours in final data set) (contours of altitude of head, interval 200 feet)</eadetcit>   </overview>  </eainfo>  <distinfo>   <distrib>    <cntinfo>     <cntorgp>      <cntorg>U.S. Geological Survey</cntorg>     </cntorgp>     <cntpos>Ask USGS -- Water Webserver Team</cntpos>     <cntaddr>      <addrtype>mailing address</addrtype>      <address>445 National Center</address>      <city>Reston</city>      <state>VA</state>      <postal>20192</postal>      <country>USA</country>     </cntaddr>     <cntvoice>1-888-275-8747 (1-888-ASK-USGS)</cntvoice>     <cntemail>http://water.usgs.gov/user_feedback_form.html</cntemail>    </cntinfo>   </distrib>   <distliab>Although this data set has been used by the U.S. Geological Survey, U.S. Department of the Interior, no warranty expressed or implied is made by the U.S. Geological Survey as to the accuracy of the data and related materials.
